title.narrative: OT 1.1. SOC.POLICY&KNOWLEDG.MANAG

description.narrative: Output 1.1 By end 2015, national authorities allocate and utilize sufficient public resources to prioritise child rights in health, education and social protection (as per 2013 MTR), which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1. By end 2015, Kazakhstan addresses disparities in the realisation of children's rights, in line with the CRC observations (ref. CRC/C/KAZ/CO/3) (as per 2013 MTR)

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses

Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination

System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Children in urban settings

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
